title: Ticket #7607: classad.ExprTree() should except when it can't parse its whole input
description:
This is wrong: 

>>> e = classad.ExprTree('foo = bar')
>>> e
foo
remarks:
Move the following to another ticket to isolate its cause:

Also, the following should fail, (and not respond with a classad of foo = bar and and a value of undefined), but I don't know if that's the exact same problem or just a similar one: 

/classad_eval 'foo = bar; bar = 5' 'foo'

2020-Apr-20 13:22:08 by tlmiller:
Consider cherry-picking this back to stable.

2020-Apr-20 13:24:01 by tlmiller:
This will require a release note; it shouldn't but could break existing user code (that supplies expression with trailing garbage).

2020-Apr-21 11:19:05 by tlmiller:
Leaving as devel-only because of the chance of breaking existing code.
check_ins:
2020-Apr-21 11:18   Check-in [59430]: (#7607) Release note. (By Todd L Miller )
2020-Apr-20 14:58   Check-in [59425]: (#7607) Make the error message less incomprehensible. (By Todd L Miller )
2020-Apr-20 13:20   Check-in [59423]: (#7607) classad.ExprTree() should fail if its argument has trailing garbage. (By Todd L Miller )
creator: tlmiller
